title: Watch DEAFHEAVEN Play Most Of Their New Album Live
description: They only skipped three tracks from Lonely People With Power. The post Watch DEAFHEAVEN Play Most Of Their New Album Live appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 47 minutes ago
excerpt: They only skipped three tracks from Lonely People With Power.
text: Deafheaven just hit the road in support of their new record Lonely People With Power and they're playing pretty much the entire record (interspersed with a few classics). The only songs from Lonely People With Power that Deafheaven didn't play were "Body Behavior", "Incidental III", and "The Marvelous Orange Tree". The full setlist is: "Incidental I" (Live Debut) "Doberman" (Live Debut) "Magnolia" (Live Debut) "Brought to the Water" "The Garden Route" (Live Debut) "Heathen" (Live Debut) "Amethyst" (Live Debut) "Worthless Animal" "Incidental II" (Live Debut) "Revelator" (Live Debut) "Dream House" "Winona" (Live Debut) Deafheaven is currently on tour with Gatecreeper and Trauma Ray as the openers. The tour kicked off on April 19 at The Belasco in Los Angeles, CA and wraps up over one month later on May 23 at The Nile in Mesa, AZ. html:
Deafheaven just hit the road in support of their new record Lonely People With Power and they're playing pretty much the entire record (interspersed with a few classics). The only songs from Lonely People With Power that Deafheaven didn't play were "Body Behavior", "Incidental III", and "The Marvelous Orange Tree". The full setlist is:

  1. "Incidental I" (Live Debut)
  2. "Doberman" (Live Debut)
  3. "Magnolia" (Live Debut)
  4. "Brought to the Water"
  5. "The Garden Route" (Live Debut)
  6. "Heathen" (Live Debut)
  7. "Amethyst" (Live Debut)
  8. "Worthless Animal"
  9. "Incidental II" (Live Debut)
  10. "Revelator" (Live Debut)
  11. "Dream House"
  12. "Winona" (Live Debut)

Deafheaven is currently on tour with Gatecreeper and Trauma Ray as the openers. The tour kicked off on April 19 at The Belasco in Los Angeles, CA and wraps up over one month later on May 23 at The Nile in Mesa, AZ. Tickets are available here.
